steps.title: Landing on Invoify home (all tests – Step 1)
details: Basic header and hero elements render, though automated UI review already flags minor layout / typography inconsistencies.

steps.title: Trying to start the invoice-creation wizard
details: Across ‘Bill From’, ‘Bill To’, line-item, tax, discount and PDF tests the very first assertion that a wizard section is visible times-out.
Typical locator failures: “Bill From :”, “Bill To :”, “1 . From & To”, “3 . Line Items”.
Result: No subsequent form-filling, validation or navigation steps are executed (all marked pending).

steps.title: Template & Logo related flows
details: UI header (“BETA English Toggle theme”) not found; therefore template list, logo upload, live preview cannot be located.
All deeper steps (choose template, upload logo, verify persistence) remain pending.

steps.title: Live preview real-time update flow
details: Script can type into form fields and see a preview panel (“Live Preview:” heading).
When fields are modified, at least one crucial value (Zip) fails to update; step flagged as fail.

steps.title: Export / email / i18n flows
details: Dashboard text (“Dashboard”, language switcher) or date formats not present, so export/email tests abort early.
PDF generation and multi-format export never reached.

steps.title: Common UI review observations (automatic)
details: Repeated cosmetic ‘looks off’ flags: mis-aligned inputs & labels, inconsistent padding/margins, button style variance, placeholder copy too generic.

emotional_arc: Real shoppers would start with optimism (page loads) but very quickly hit a wall: essential wizard sections never appear or take too long → immediate confusion and mistrust. Those who do reach the form encounter alignment/padding quirks that feel unpolished. Live preview sometimes lags, eroding confidence that edits save. Inconsistent button styling and missing language toggle add to an overall sense of an unfinished beta.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Critical content not rendering / selector mismatch
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Customers can’t even begin key tasks (enter Bill From/Bill To, add line items, taxes, etc.). They will abandon immediately.
next_actions: Audit component mounting logic—are sections hidden behind feature flags or route guards?
Add explicit page-level loading skeletons or spinners so users know content is coming.
Stabilise element text & IDs; expose data-test attributes so minor copy tweaks don’t break rendering or tests.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Perceived performance (5 s timeouts consistently hit)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Waiting for invisible elements feels like a crash; poor FID hurts SEO & user trust.
next_actions: Lazy-load heavy components after first meaningful paint.
Defer unnecessary fonts/scripts; prioritise wizard HTML in initial bundle.
Instrument TTI and add performance budgets in CI.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Visual inconsistency signals low quality and can slow data entry.
next_actions: Adopt a design-token system (spacing scale, type ramp).
Run a UI regression tool (Storybook + Chromatic) to catch drift.
Audit tailwind/utility classes for duplicated overrides.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users rely on instant feedback to avoid billing errors; mismatches breed frustration and mistrust.
next_actions: Debounce preview rendering but ensure change-event updates every bound field.
Add field-level validation hints (e.g., green ticks) so users see success, not only errors.
Write unit tests for computed totals, taxes, discounts.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Generic placeholders (‘Name…’) give no clue about desired format; causes user hesitation.
next_actions: Replace lorem / generic placeholders with realistic examples (e.g., “ACME Corp.”, “123-456-7890”).
Review microcopy for spelling and parallel structure.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Language-switch and header text fail to appear; non-English users blocked.
next_actions: Ensure language picker is in DOM on first load; fallback language strings should be complete.
Add aria-labels to dynamic buttons and ensure focus order after language change.

first_tackles.description: Guarantee wizard sections mount immediately—add deterministic IDs / data-test attributes and remove copy-dependent selectors.
Introduce visible loading states to avoid ‘blank screen’ during async component fetch.
Standardise spacing / button styles via a shared design system token file—quick CSS pass will remove majority of ‘looks off’ flags.
Fix live preview binding for all fields (easiest repro: Zip) and add unit tests to prevent regression.
Replace placeholder copy with realistic examples and proof-read for spelling; low effort, high perceived polish.
